entries.meaning: (nautical) A small anchor used for warping a vessel.

verbs.description: kedge (third-person singular simple present kedges, present participle kedging, simple past and past participle kedged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To warp (a vessel) by carrying out a kedge in a boat, dropping it overboard, and hauling the vessel up to it.
(intransitive, of a vessel) To move with the help of a kedge, as described above.
examples: […]  there was a stretch of twelve miles of channel running in a north-easterly direction which the ship could not possibly negotiate under sail unless a change of wind should occur — of which there seemed to be absolutely no prospect. The only alternative, therefore, would be to kedge those twelve miles; truly a most formidable undertaking for four persons — one of them being a girl — to attempt.
